JStruct user help

The program JStruct allows interactive editing of Java programs using structured blocks (NSD: Nassi-Shneiderman Diagrams ) to implement the algorithms.
The program provides graphical editing with copy, move, zoom, expand etc., comments for each block, javadoc structured or inline, import and export of java source files. It exporst images in various raster and vector formats. It offers high interactivity: tooltips and context menus, undo and redo functionality.
JStruct can be used in the following ways:
  • Development and Learning: creating from scratch a new Java program, you use the GUI to add new structured elements, comments etc ...
  • Reverse engineering: highlighting the structure of classes and methods will facilitate the understanding of the code. Also you can use colors, add comments and change the variable names.
  • Documentation: exporting an image you have complete control over fonts, colors, details.
  • Tool add-on: adding JStruct tool to an IDE (eg JCreator ) you add a graphical structured environment.
  • Pretty-printer: a passage of a source java file in JStruct (imports + exports) produces a standard formatted output.
Topics:
  1. User interface
  2. structured elements
    • sequences
    • selections
    • iterations
    • Java Special
  3. export
  4. Import

files example

Some examples are included in the directory Examples:
  • FullUserTest.nsd- Examples of syntax rules: read the comments for the blocks.
  • Test01.java - Tests for Exception and Try-Catch: import the file in JScript.
  • Test02.java - Test for enum: import the file in JScript.
  • Test04.java - Other tests for enum: import the file in JScript.
  • Test05.java - Test interface, lambda: import the file in JScript.
behavioral control

By flags on first comment (unit):
       //@JStructOptions: ADDJAVADOCPUBLIC, PROGRAMDOCONTOP, SETSOURCEVERSION
  • PROGRAMDOCONTOP if present JStruct places inline comments (non javadoc, using '//') before the code, else comments are placed on the right.
  • ADDJAVADOCEXTRA adds infos about JSruct
  • ADDJAVADOCPUBLIC if present JStruct adds missed Javadoc comments only to public Methods else it updates all Methods (with the exclusion for @override).
  • SETSOURCEVERSION if present JStruct sets/updates the build count in top comment.
  • ADDJAVADOCIMAGE if present JStruct adds a link for an exported NSD image in javadoc.
